oracle.pg.hbase

Class OraclePropertyGraphUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.common.OracleConvertersUtilsBase
      • oracle.pg.common.OraclePropertyGraphUtilsBase
        • oracle.pg.hbase.OraclePropertyGraphUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    oracle.pg.common.messages.MesgConsts

    public class OraclePropertyGraphUtils
extends OraclePropertyGraphUtilsBase
    This class contains utility functions to help manage property graphs stored in an Apache HBase Database

    • Field Summary

      • copyGraph

        public static void copyGraph(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                             java.lang.String graphName,
                             java.lang.String newGraphName)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.Exception
        Copy the property graph (including its associated tables) to the specified graph name (if it is not empty). This operation will not copy existing indices into the new graph.
        Parameters:
        conf - the Configuration object with all the HBase connection information.
        graphName - the name of the property graph to be copied
        newGraphName - the new name of the graph
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • dropPropertyGraph

        public static void dropPropertyGraph(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                     java.lang.String szGraphName)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.Exception
        Drops the specified property graph (including its associated tables). This operation cannot be undone.
        Parameters:
        conf - the Configuration object with all the HBase connection information.
        szGraphName - the name of the graph to drop.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

                             java.lang.String tableName)
                      throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        tableName - the name of the table to drop.

      • exportEdgeFlatFile

        public static void exportEdgeFlatFile(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                      java.io.OutputStream osEdge,
                                      int dop,
                                      boolean append,
                                      boolean closeStream)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function exports the edges of a given property graph into OPE flat file
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        osEdge - an OutputStream object for the edge flat file
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat file. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat file removing all existing data.
        closeStream - whether to close the OutputStream or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static void exportFlatFiles(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                   java.io.OutputStream osVertex,
                                   java.io.OutputStream osEdge,
                                   boolean append,
                                   int dop)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        osVertex - an OutputStream object for the vertex flat file
        osEdge - an OutputStream object for the edge flat file
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat files. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat files removing all existing data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static void exportFlatFiles(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                   java.io.OutputStream osVertex,
                                   java.io.OutputStream osEdge,
                                   int dop,
                                   boolean append,
                                   boolean closeStreams)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        osVertex - an OutputStream object for the vertex flat file
        osEdge - an OutputStream object for the edge flat file
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat files. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat files removing all existing data.
        closeStreams - whether to close the OutputStreams or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static final void exportFlatFiles(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                         java.lang.String vertexFileName,
                                         java.lang.String edgeFileName,
                                         boolean append)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        vertexFileName - the name of the vertex flat file e.g. graph.opv
        edgeFileName - the name of the edge flat file e.g. graph.ope
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat files removing all existing data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • exportFlatFiles

        public static final void exportFlatFiles(OraclePropertyGraph pg,
                                         java.lang.String vertexFileName,
                                         java.lang.String edgeFileName,
                                         int dop,
                                         boolean append)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function exports a given property graph into two flat files: one for vertices and the other for edges.
        Parameters:
        pg - the property graph that will be exported into flat files
        vertexFileName - the name of the vertex flat file e.g. graph.opv
        edgeFileName - the name of the edge flat file e.g. graph.ope
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat files. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat files removing all existing data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

        osVertex - an OutputStream object for the vertex flat file
        dop - the degree of parallelism used when writing the data into the flat file. This will use multiple threads to optimize writing performance.
        append - if false, overwrite the existing flat file removing all existing data.
        closeStream - whether to close the OutputStream or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getGraphNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGraphNames(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
        List all the names of the property graphs stored in the given database
        Parameters:
        conf - the Configuration object with all the HBase connection information.
        Returns:
        a list of Strings with the names of the property graphs in the database.

      • getHexSplitsWithEndpoints

        public static byte[][] getHexSplitsWithEndpoints(java.lang.String startKey,
                                                 java.lang.String endKey,
                                                 int numRegions)
        Generates an array with the splits (including the end points) for the specified start and end keys.
        Parameters:
        startKey - the start key of the splits as a byte array.
        endKey - the end key of the splits as a byte array.
        numRegions - the number of splits to define.
        Returns:
        an array of byte[] with the split keys. The size of this array is the numRegions + 1 (as startKey and endKey are included in the array).

      • printByteArray

        public static void printByteArray(java.lang.String marker,
                                  byte[] ba,
                                  java.io.PrintStream ps)
        Prints a string representation of the byte array to the specified PrintStream
        Parameters:
        marker - an additional marker to be printed with the byte array
        ba - the byte array to be printed
        ps - a PrintStream object where the byte array will be printed

        Quietly close an Connection object handling a connection to an Apache HBase Database
        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection to be closed.

        public static void quietlyCloseConnections(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Connection[] connections)
        Quietly close an array of Connection objects handling connections to an Apache HBase Database.
        Parameters:

      • renameGraph

        public static void renameGraph(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                               java.lang.String graphName,
                               java.lang.String newGraphName)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.Exception
        Renames the property graph (including its associated tables) to the specified graph name (if it does not exists or is not empty). This operation will not take into account existing indices. Indices should be removed before calling this operation and re-executed using the new graph instance.
        Parameters:
        conf - the Configuration object with all the HBase connection information.
        graphName - the name of the property graph to be renamed
        newGraphName - the new name of the property graph.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • sameSubArray

        public static boolean sameSubArray(byte[] ba1,
                                   byte[] ba2,
                                   int iStart,
                                   int iLen)
        Verifies if two byte arrays are equals from the specified start and length.
        Parameters:
        ba1 - the first byte array to compare
        ba2 - the second byte array to compare
        iStart - the start of the sub-array to compare
        iLen - the length of the sub-array to compare
        Returns:
        true if the sub-arrays are equal, else return false.
